articles.description: The world may be faced with a new foe, but old ones lie in wait if lockdowns disrupt existing immunisation programmes
articles.content: In The Conjurer, a 16th-century painting by Dutch artist Hieronymus Bosch, a spectator stands in rapt attention as a magic trick is performed. He bends forward, wholly absorbed by the spectacle, blissfully unaware of the man behind him casually picking his po… [+5040 chars]

articles.author: By Harry Howard For Mailonline
articles.title: More people leave their homes and flock to DIY stores and parks despite Covid-19 lockdown - Daily Mail
articles.description: Shoppers were pictured waiting in long queues at B&Q hardware stores around the country on Sunday before they filled their trolleys with items including plant pots and lawn mowers.
articles.content:
Thousands of Britons ignored repeated warnings to stay home as part of ongoing efforts to clamp down on coronavirus by heading to DIY stores, parks and beaches on Sunday. 
People were seen heading to stores in parts of the country including Edinburgh, Swanse… [+20568 chars]

articles.title: Coronavirus: Chile to introduce controversial certificate - BBC News
articles.description: People who recover from Covid-19 will get a certificate despite a World Health Organization warning.
articles.content:
Image copyrightReutersImage caption
 Chile has confirmed more than 13,000 cases of Covid-19
Chile's government has said it will go ahead with a controversial plan to issue certificates to people who have recovered from Covid-19.
The documents would be give… [+1338 chars]

articles.author: Ryan Smith
articles.title: Ten more coronavirus cases in Hartlepool as another patient treated at town's health trust dies - Hartlepool Mail
articles.description: Two more people have died after testing positive for coronavirus at Hartlepool’s NHS hospital trust as the number of cases in the town rose to 165.
articles.content:
The statistics show 69 people have died in hospitals covered by North Tees and Hartlepool NHS Foundation Trust as of today, Monday, April 27.
In total, 938 people who had tested positive for coronavirus have died across the North Easts hospital trusts, an in… [+3063 chars]

articles.content:
